This app demonstrates:

1. Basic nav_panel with just a title
2. Nav panel with a custom value
3. Nav panel with an icon using Font Awesome
4. Shows the currently selected panel value
5. Uses nav_spacer() for layout spacing

The parameters demonstrated are:
- title: The display text for the panel
- value: Custom identifier for the panel
- icon: An icon element to display with the panel title

Key features:
1. Uses express mode syntax
2. Minimal dependencies
3. No external data files
4. Shows all possible nav_panel parameters
5. Includes proper Font Awesome setup
6. Demonstrates reactive behavior with panel selection

To run this app, save it as `app.py` and run it using:
```bash
shiny run app.py
```

Package dependencies:
- shiny

The app creates a navigation interface with three panels, each demonstrating different parameter combinations of the nav_panel component. It also shows how to track the currently selected panel using Shiny's reactive system.
